msContents.summary: Declaration on oath by Didymos that a flock of 100 sheep is not his but belongs to Mysthes the exegetes

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank
11 lines of writing by a hand which is practiced but irregular and uses letters of varying size

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 51 (original no. 32) in Bell's inventory

div.ab: Didymos son of Longinos to Amathis son of Sokmenis and Pekysis son of Heron and the other elders of the village of Philadelphia. I swear by the fortune of the lords emperors Severus and Antoninus and Geta that these 100 sheep are not mine, but belong to Mysthes the exegetes, those concerning which you want a collection from me on account of weighing. If I appear selling wool, may I be liable for my oath. I, Nilos son of [.....] the former exegetes of the [city] of the Arsinoites, wrote the entire text on behalf of Didymos.
